message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to start with a price of $18,000. What do you think?
Hey Alice, $18,000 is a bit steep for me. I'm really interested in the product, but my budget is closer to $8,000. Would you be willing to come down to $10,000?
I understand you're on a tight budget, Bob, but I have to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need $14,000 to make it worth my while. Can you consider that?
Alice, I appreciate you meeting me halfway, but $14,000 is still outside my comfort zone. I'm willing to go up to $11,000, but that's my absolute maximum. What do you say?

I appreciate your honesty, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. How about $13,500? It's a bit higher than your maximum, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle again.

Alice, I understand you need to make a profit, but $13,500 is still too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $12,000, but that's my final offer. If we can't agree on that, I'll have to explore other options.

I understand you're running out of patience, Bob, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $13,500. However, I'm willing to throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. I'll include a 1-year warranty and a free maintenance package. How about we meet at $13,500 and I'll add these extras?
